title: How do Chinese companies make a profit by selling mobile phones at such low cost? - Quora

response.answer_text: They don’t make money, on purpose. They use predatory low source pricing to scare away any competitors. These companies all work for China Inc. - China is actually a single company, the biggest company in the world. These individual factory/companies don’t make money so no one can compete - and they extract foreign currencies from western buyers. The China Inc wants to obtain western currency. They want to be the only one fulfilling the western orders. China is not really a free economy - the people of China do not own land or properties. Even their houses are only for 70 years rights of use - the land belongs to country, and hence any business that runs on the land has to belong to the country. The Chinese government is the biggest capitalistic company. Consider all Chinese companies their subordinates - and you get the idea. The Chinese companies purposely do not make profits, so the western buyers are addicted. That is their game plan. They sell labor at amazing low cost to obtain buyer contracts. It is important to explain basics of supply chain and channel pricing. When a merchandise is sold in USA in a store like Target or Amazon, it carry a retail price of say 30 dollars. But the merchandise is a western brand (e.g., Apple or Nike), it is only manufactured/assembled in China. The stores obtain the source items for about 2 dollars, and the rest of the money (28) is pure channel margin. The Chinese factory’s profit is made within this 2 dollars. For that they spend capital, build factory, hire workers, and make things, and then sell their source items for amazing low price. When we say “China profit’ we are talking about the profit withim this 2 dollar source pricing. The rest of the “profit” has nothing to do with Chinese factory and factory owners. Low cost of Chinese goods also have little to do with American customers benefits or “enjoyment” - the channel margin these western companies extracts is staggering anyways. The Chinese factory charge just enough to cover their cost. They make revenue and cash flow, but nit profits. China decided to make small profits on that source … they are willing to “make no money so that no one else can make money”. Note: please be mindful “Not making profit” does not mean “not making money”. It just means artificially setting your profit margin to near zero, so that Vietnam, Mexico and Africa and everyone has to bleed if they want to compete with China and fulfill western manufacturing orders. It is raw capitalism.  Note 2: The supply chain is badly explained to many. The Chinese workers hate America - they think they work in a sweat shop and Americans buy their products for 3 dollars. No, it is priced at 30. The American consumers may not like China, because they think Chin made 20 or 29 dollars. None of these is true. In between is greedy corporate America and Wall Street that regulate the behavior of Corporate America. The Chinese companies are shrewd and super tough businessman.
